original: vopṛktasyetyucyamāne na doṣo darvirityādāvapṛktatvepīti na vācyam /
analyzed: vā upṛktasya iti ucyamāne na doṣaḥ darviḥ ityādau apṛkta tve pi iti na vācyam
translated: that there is no fault in saying upṛkta (connected), even though it is unconnected in darvi (a kind of ladle) and so on. This should not be said.

original: tathā ca rājakṛtvānamācaṣṭe rājakṛtvayatītyatrāpi prasañga iti /
analyzed: tathā ca rājakṛtvānam ācaṣṭe rājakṛtvayati iti atra api prasañgaḥ iti
translated: And in the same way, there is the application of rājakṛtvā (of the king) and rājakṛtvayati (he makes the king do) here also.

analyzed: tathā jana sana khana krama gamaḥ viṭ iti atra rakṣitena uktam
translated: Similarly, it has been said by Rakṣita in the case of janasanakha (people, nails, and spades), krama (order), gam (going), and viṭ (a kind of bamboo),

analyzed: ikāraḥ veḥ apṛktasya iti viśeṣaṇa arthaḥ iti
translated: that the specification ikāra is for the purpose of distinguishing the unconnected.

original: asati tasmin paralokadṛśvayatītyatra ṇici ṭilope kṛte vakāralopaḥ syāt /
analyzed: asati tasmin para loka dṛśvayati iti atra ṇ ici ṭi lope kṛte vakāra lopaḥ syāt
translated: If that were not so, then in paralokadṛśvaya (he sees the other world), after the elision of ṭi in the denominative, there would be elision of va.

analyzed: tasmāt ikāraḥ viśeṣaṇa arthaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, ikāra is for the purpose of distinguishing.

analyzed: etat asiddha bahiraṅgam antaraṅgaḥ iti asya iti asiddha tvena apravarttanāt upapadyate
translated: This is not established. The internal is external. The elision of the initial is like the elision of the initial here. Since it is not established, it is appropriate that it does not operate.

analyzed: yadi eva yuvoḥ anākau iti atra yat ukta rakṣitena aṅga sajñā nimittayoḥ yakāra vakārayoḥ grahaṇe nunāsikayoḥ yakāra vakārayoḥ grahaṇam anarthakam eva iti
translated: If it is so, in yad eva yuvor anākau, what Rākṣita said that in the inclusion of the y and v caused by the knowledge of the subsidiary, the inclusion of the nasal y and v is meaningless,

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: that is incorrect.

analyzed: pūrva ukta krameṇa
translated: In the sequence stated earlier, in rājā kṛtvā yāti, paraloke paśyati, the substitution would be applicable.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said.

analyzed: bha adhikārāt prāk yaḥ asiddha adhikāram āhuḥ  tad matena vāhaḥ uṭha ṭi lopayoḥ ābhāt śāstrīya tvan na asti
translated: Before the section on bh, they say that the section on non-established is not established.🔽According to that view, since there is no bh or ṭilop in the case of vā, there is no scriptural nature.

analyzed: atosiddha paribhāṣāyā karttavyāyām asiddha vat atra ābhāt iti asya apravṛttiḥ iti adoṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the to-be-performed rule of non-established, since it appears as if non-established here, there is no fault in its non-operation.

original: jñāpaka cātra samarthānā prathamādvā ityatra samarthagrahaṇam /
analyzed: jñāpaka ca atra samarthānām prathamāt vā iti atra samartha grahaṇam
translated: And the indicator here is the inclusion of the capable in the first or second.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is like this.

analyzed: yadi eṣā na syāt
translated: If this were not so.

original: tadā samarthitasarvakāryāttaddhito yatha syādityemartha samarthagrahaṇamanarthaka syāt /
analyzed: tadā samarthita sarva kāryāt taddhitaḥ samartha grahaṇam anarthaka syāt
translated: Then the inclusion of the capable would be meaningless, with the meaning that the taddhita would be like that from all the capable actions.

analyzed: goḥ a taddhita luki iti atra a taddhita grahana ke cid āhuḥ
translated: In the rule gora-tad-dhita-luki, some say that the word tad-dhita should not be taken.

analyzed: tat hi sup luki mā abhūt iti evam artha kriyate rajagavīyati iti
translated: This is done for the purpose of preventing the formation of ra-jagavīyatī in sub-luki.

original: atra ca prāgeva niṣpannaṣṭac taduttarakāla kyaci subluki yadā pravṛtto'pi ṭac nivarttate tadā bhavati // //
analyzed: atra ca prāk eva niṣpannaḥ ṭac tad uttara kāla kyaci sup luki yadā pravṛttaḥ api ṭac nivarttate tadā bhavati  /
translated: And here, even before the completion of the ṭac, when the ṭac is engaged in the kyaci sub-luki after that time, it is stopped, then it happens.

analyzed: iti sīradeva kṛtāyā paribhāṣā vṛttau ṅī āp pādaḥ
translated: Thus, in the Paribhāṣā-vṛtti composed by Sīradeva, the ṅyāp-pāda is completed.

analyzed: niranubandhaka grahaṇe na sa anubandhakasya
translated: When a word without an affix is taken, a word with an affix is not.

analyzed: eka anubandhaka grahaṇe na dvi anubandhakasya
translated: When a word with one affix is taken, a word with two affixes is not.

original: tena sadavyayatavya iti ṣaṣṭhīsamāsaniṣedhe niranubhandhakasyaiva tavyasya grahaṇa na tavyataḥ /
analyzed: tena sat avyaya tavyaḥ iti ṣaṣṭhī samāsa niṣedhe niranubhandhakasya eva tavyasya na tavyataḥ
translated: Therefore, in the prohibition of the genitive compound sad-avyaya-tavyam, only the tavyam without an affix is taken, not the tavyam with an affix.

original: tathā diva ut ityatra divdhātoruttva na bhavati /
analyzed: tathā divaḥ u t iti atra div dhātoḥ ut tva na bhavati
translated: Similarly, in div-ut, the ut is not formed from the root div.

original: akṣadyūriti /🔽yato nāva ityatraikānubandhakasya yato grahaṇa na dvyanubandhakasya ṇyataḥ /
analyzed: akṣadyūḥ iti  yatas nāvaḥ iti atra eka anubandhakasya yatas na dvi anubandhakasya
translated: Aksha-dūra.🔽Here, when a word with one affix is taken, a word with two affixes is not.

original: jñāpaka cātra vāmadevāḍ ḍyaḍḍyau iti ḍyaḍyatorḍitvam tacca na karttavyam /
analyzed: jñāpaka ca atra vāmadevāt ḍyaṭ ḍyau iti ḍya ḍyatoḥ ḍi tvam tat ca na karttavyam
translated: And here, the indication is vāmadeva-ḍyaḍḍya, the ḍyaḍḍya is in the locative case, and that should not be done.

original: yasyeti ca iti lopenaiva vāmadevyasya siddhatvāt /
analyzed: yasya iti ca iti lopena eva vāmadevyasya siddha tvāt
translated: And in yasya (whose), the elision itself establishes the Vāmadevya.

analyzed: tat kṛtam anayoḥ astitva jñāpayati
translated: That establishes the existence of these two.

analyzed: tat uktam
translated: That has been said.

analyzed: siddha yasya iti lopena kimartha ya yatau ḍ itau
translated: What is the purpose of the two dits in yasya by the elision?

original: grahaṇa mā tadarthe bhūdvāmadevyasya nañsvara iti /
analyzed: mā tad arthe bhūt vāmadevyasya nañ svaraḥ iti
translated: Let the aphorism be for that purpose, not for the svar of the negative in Vāmadevya.

analyzed: ke cit pratyaya viṣayāḥ niranubandhaka paribhāṣām āhuḥ
translated: Some say that the anubandha-less rule applies to the case of suffixes.

analyzed: etat tu jṛ vraścyoḥ t kvi iti atra anunyāsa kāreṇa uktam
translated: But this has been stated by the author of the Nyāsa in the case of jṛvṛścyoḥ tkv (Pāṇini 6.1.10).

original: tathā na ca kavateryaṅi ityatra nyāsakāreṇa lugvikaraṇaparibhāṣayā''dādikasya kauteragrahaṇe siddhe kavateriti śtipā nirddeśastaudādikasya
analyzed: tathā na ca kavateḥ yaṅi iti atra nyāsa kāreṇa luk vikaraṇa paribhāṣayā ādādikasya kauteḥ agrahaṇe siddhe kavateḥ iti nirddeśaḥ taudādikasya
translated: Similarly, in the case of na ca kavateḥ yaṅ (Pāṇini 6.4.10), the author of the Nyāsa has stated that the rule of the elision of the affix is established by the rule of the elision of the vikaraṇa, and the mention of kavateḥ is for the purpose of excluding the inclusion of kauteḥ which begins with ā.

analyzed: kuvarteḥ grahaṇa nirāsa arthaḥ iti yat ukta tat upapadyate
translated: What has been said - that it is for the purpose of excluding the inclusion of kuvartteḥ which begins with tau - is appropriate.

analyzed: anyathā antarañgāyāḥ niranubandhaka paribhāṣāyāḥ viṣaye luk vikaraṇa paribhāṣā katham abhidhīyate
translated: Otherwise, how is the rule of the elision of the vikaraṇa stated in the case of the anubandha-less rule which is internal?

original: antaraṅgatva tu niranubandhakaparibhāṣāyā upadeśa eva itsajñāpravarttanāt /
analyzed: tu niranubandhaka paribhāṣāyāḥ upadeśe eva i t sajñā pravarttanāt
translated: But the anubandha-less rule is internal only because of the application of the designation it itself in the teaching.

analyzed: lum vikaraṇa paribhāṣāyāḥ tu vidhānāt
translated: But in the rule for the substitution of luma, it is said that it is an external rule, because the substitution of luma is enjoined at a later time.

analyzed: gaṇa pāṭha viśeṣa parijñānāt ca
translated: And also because of the knowledge of the special order of the group.

analyzed: anye tu sāmānyena niranubandhaka paribhāṣām āhuḥ
translated: But others state the general rule without a suffix.

original: ata evāsterbhūrityatra śtipā nirddeśo vaicitryārtha ukto nyākṛtā na tvasu kṣepeṇa ityasya nirāsārtha iti /
analyzed: atas eva asteḥ bhūḥ iti atra nirddeśaḥ vaicitrya arthaḥ uktaḥ nyākṛtā na tu asu kṣepeṇa iti asya nirāsa arthaḥ iti
translated: For this very reason, the indication of the affix śti in asteḥ bhūḥ is said to be for the sake of variety, not for the purpose of excluding the asu of asu kṣepa.
Because the exclusion of that is established by the rule without a suffix.

original: iya ca ekānubandhakaparibhāṣā vasoḥ saprasāranam ityatra nopatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: iya ca eka anubandhaka paribhāṣā vasoḥ sa prasāranam iti atra na upatiṣṭhate
translated: And this rule of one suffix does not apply in vasor saprasāraṇam.

analyzed: vasu ruj it karana sāmarthyāt
translated: Because of the power of the substitution of vas and ru.

analyzed: tena vasu grahaṇe kvasu vasvoḥ ubhayoḥ grahaṇa bhavati
translated: Therefore, in the use of vas, the use of both vas and vas is obtained.

original: nanu cāsati vasurugittve vasaḥ saprasāraṇamityucyamāne vasa ācchādana ityasya varmmavasaḥ paśyetyatrāpi saprasāraṇa prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu ca asati vasu ruk it tve vasaḥ sa prasāraṇam iti ucyamāne vasaḥ ācchādane iti asya varmma vasaḥ paśya iti atra api sa prasāraṇa prāpnoti
translated: But if there is no vas and ru, when vasor saprasāraṇam is stated, the use of vas in the sense of covering is obtained even in varma vas paśye.

analyzed: na etat
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: vase ācchādane iti asya sānubandhaka tvāt
translated: Because the use of vas in the sense of covering has a suffix.

original: na ca vasa nivāsa ityasya niranubandhakasya grahaṇamāśaṅkanīyam /
analyzed: na ca vasa nivāse iti asya niranubandhakasya grahaṇam āśaṅkanīyam
translated: And the use of vas in the sense of dwelling without a suffix should not be suspected.

analyzed: tatra kvip āśrayasya eva sa prasāraṇasya siddha tvāt
translated: There, because the form with the augment is already established for the root with the augment.

original: nanu vasīrugittva vidvānivācaratīti kvibantāt tkvāpratyaye vidvasitvetyatrodito vā iti vikalpeneḍāgamārtha kasmānna bhavati pratyayanubandho
analyzed: nanu vidvān iva ācarati iti kvip antāt vidvān iva ācarati iti kvip antāt vidvasitvā iti atra uditaḥ vā iti vikalpena iḍā āgama artha kasmāt na bhavati
translated: But why is the augment not added by the option expressed in the rule vidvāniti vā when the affix ktvā is added to the root ending in kvi, as in vidvāniti vā carati (he acts like a wise man), for the purpose of adding the augment?

analyzed: hi eṣa samudāya anubandhaḥ eva
translated: For this is a connection with the affix, not with the whole.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: anabhidhānāt kvibatra nāstīti na tadarthamugittvamiti videḥ śaturvasuḥ ityatra rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: anabhidhānāt kvip atra na asti iti na tad artham u k it tvam iti videḥ śatuḥ vasuḥ iti atra rakṣitaḥ
translated: Because it is not mentioned, it does not exist in kvi. Therefore, for the sake of that, the augment is not added to vid. The rule śatuḥ vasuḥ protects this.

analyzed: bhāṣye tu vasoḥ api dvi anubandhaka tvam uktam
translated: But in the Bhāṣya, it is said that vas also has two connections.

original: tathā ca videḥ śaturvasuḥ ityatra bhāṣyam /
analyzed: tathā ca videḥ śatuḥ vasuḥ iti atra bhāṣyam
translated: And in that way, in the case of vid, śatuḥ vasuḥ, there is a Bhāṣya:

original: vasuriti dvisakārako nirddeśa iti tatraikaḥ śrutyartho'parastu dvyanubandhakatvārtha iti /
analyzed: vasuḥ iti dvi sakārakaḥ nirddeśaḥ iti tatra ekaḥ śruti artha uparaḥ tu dvi anubandhaka tva arthaḥ iti
translated: Vas is a designation with two s-s. One of them has the meaning of the Vedic text, the other has the meaning of having two connections.

analyzed: anye tu āhuḥ
translated: But others say:

analyzed: anubandhasya sthānivat bhāvena vasuḥ api na eka anubandhaḥ iti
translated: Because of the rule sthāninivadbhāva, vas also is not a single connection.

analyzed: na etat
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: sthānivat bhāvena hi anubandha kāryāṇām atideśaḥ na anubandhasya eva
translated: For by the rule sthāninivadbhāva, the effects of the connection are extended, not the connection itself.

original: syādetadekānubandhakagrahaṇe na dvyanubandhakasyeti pratiṣedhānna hyatra ki cidekānubandhakamastīti vasoḥ saprasāraṇam ityatra rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: syāt etat eka anubandhaka grahaṇe na dvi anubandhakasya iti pratiṣedhāt na hi atra ki cit eka anubandhakam asti iti vasoḥ sa prasāraṇam iti atra rakṣitaḥ
translated: This may be said: In the case of the singular ending, the dual ending is not taken, so it is not taken here because there is no singular ending. This is protected in the case of vasor saprasāraṇam.

original: yadyeva yadvyākhyātamauṅa āpaḥ ityatra rakṣitena na hi sthānivadbhāvenānubandho bhavatyapi tu kārya sthanivadbhāvaśāstrasya sthānikāryārthatvādanubandhāśca
analyzed: yadi eva yat vyākhyātam auṅaḥ āpaḥ iti atra rakṣitena na hi sthānivat bhāvena anubandhaḥ bhavati api tu kārya sthanivat bhāva śāstrasya sthāni kārya artha tvāt anubandhāḥ ca
translated: If it is so, what has been explained in the case of auṅ āpaḥ is protected by Rakṣita. For the ending does not occur by the rule of the substitute being like the original, but rather the rule of the substitute being like the original has the purpose of the substitute. And the endings

analyzed: kārya arthāḥ na tu kāryāṇi iti
translated: are for the purpose of the substitute, not for the substitute itself.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: yatas tatra api pūrva ukta krameṇa dvi anubandhaka pratiṣedhāt auṭ sthānikasya oṅaḥ na syāt
translated: Because even there, due to the prohibition of the dual ending in the previously mentioned order, the auṅ of the substitute would not be taken.

original: etannyāyānusāreṇaiva gaṅkuṭādisūtre kai gai śabda ityasyaiva grahaṇa syādityavadhāraṇa yujyate /
analyzed: etad nyāya anusāreṇa eva gaṅkuṭa ādi sūtre kai gai śabdaḥ iti asya eva grahaṇa syāt iti avadhāraṇa yujyate
translated: In accordance with this reasoning, it is proper to determine that only the word kai gai is taken in the sūtra on Gaṅkuṭa and so on.

original: tathā hīṇsthāniko yo gādeśaḥ sthānivadbhāvena sānubandhaka iti tasyāpyagrahaṇam /
analyzed: tathā hi iṇ sthānikaḥ yaḥ ga ādeśaḥ sthānivat bhāvena sa anubandhakaḥ iti tasya api agrahaṇam
translated: For thus, the ga substitution which is in the place of iṇa is with the ending by the rule of the substitute being like the original. Even that is not taken.

original: na caiva vācyameva hi gāṅādeśaṅakāro na karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca eva vācyam eva hi na karttavyaḥ
translated: And this should not be said: The ṅ of the ga substitution should not be made.

original: sthānivadbhāveneṇdhātoriveṅādeśagāśabdasyāpyagrahaṇāt /🔽yato'sati ṅakāre niranubandhakaparibhāṣāyā ihāvyāpāre pramāṇa na syāt /
analyzed: sthānivat bhāvena iṇ dhātoḥ iva iṅ ādeśa gā śabdasya api agrahaṇāt  yatas asati ṅakāre niranubandhaka paribhāṣāyāḥ iha a vyāpāre na syāt
translated: Because the letter ṅ, like the root sthā, does not take the augment ṇa, even though the letter ṅ is substituted for ṇ.🔽Because if there were no ṅ, there would be no evidence for the rule that the suffix is not to be compounded.

original: nanvasyā paribhāṣāyā satyāmutkarādibhyaśchaḥ naḍādīnā kuk ca iti naḍakīya ityādāveva niranubandhakatvādāyannādi sūtreṇeyādeśaḥ prāpnoti
analyzed: nanu asyā paribhāṣāyā satyām utkara ādibhyaḥ chaḥ naḍa ādīnām kuk ca iti naḍakīyaḥ ityādau eva niranubandhaka tvāt āyannādi sūtreṇa iyādeśaḥ prāpnoti
translated: But if this rule exists, then in words like naḍakīya, the substitution of ṅ for ṇ would occur by the rule beginning with āyan, because of the absence of compounding, in words like utkara, etc., where the suffix ṅ is not compounded.

analyzed: na tu chaṇa ādau sānubandhaka tvāt tauttirīyam iti
translated: But not in words like chhaṇ, etc., because of the presence of compounding, as in tautīriya.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: āyannādi sūtre na pratyayagrahaṇamapi tu varṇagrahanam /
analyzed: āyan ādi sūtre na pratyaya grahaṇam api tu varṇa grahanam
translated: In the rule beginning with āyan, the suffix is not mentioned, but rather the letter.

original: nanu naḍakīyādisiddhyartha naḍādīnā kuk ca ityanena kimartha chapratyaya kṛtvā kugāgamaḥ kriyate na naḍādibhyaḥ kuṭ cetyevocyeta /
analyzed: nanu naḍakīya ādi siddhi artha naḍa ādīnām kuk ca iti anena kimartham chapratyaya kṛtvā kuk āgamaḥ kriyate na naḍa ādibhyaḥ kuṭ ca iti eva ucyeta
translated: But why, for the sake of deriving words like naḍakīya, is the suffix ṅ made and then the augment ku added, instead of simply saying kuṭ for naḍādi?

original: eva hi naḍādibhya iti pañcamīnirddeśena lāghava bhavati /
analyzed: eva hi naḍa ādibhyaḥ iti pañcamī nirddeśena lāghava bhavati
translated: For then it would be easier with the genitive indication naḍādīnām.

original: takṣṇo nalopaśceti gaṇasūtra na karttavya bhavati /
analyzed: takṣṇaḥ na lopaḥ ca iti gaṇa sūtra na karttavya bhavati
translated: The declensional rule taksno na lopas would not have to be made.

analyzed: pada sajñayā eva lopasya siddha tvāt
translated: Because the elision is already established by the word-form itself.

analyzed: tathā ca tatra rakṣitaḥ
translated: And thus it is preserved there.

original: parādau kuṭi kṛte takṣṇī nalopaśceti vacanamarthakam /
analyzed: para ādau kṛte takṣṇī na lopaḥ ca iti vacanam arthakam
translated: The statement When the affix ku is added to para and other words, there is elision of na is meaningless.

analyzed: pratyaya ādeḥ tu vidhīyamānaḥ īya ādeśaḥ na syāt iti
translated: The substitution of iya would not be prescribed by the affix.

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

original: nanu parādau kuṭi kṛte svādiṣu iti padasajñayā'vagrahaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu para ādau kuṭi kṛte su ādiṣu iti pada sajñayā avagrahaḥ prāpnoti
translated: Indeed, when the affix ku is added to para and other words, the elision would be obtained by the name of the word.

analyzed: yathā uktam ekāt ākinic ca a sahāyaḥ iti atra a kinici karttavyaḥ ākinicaḥ vidhānam avagraha nirāsa artham iti
translated: As it is said, in the case of ekādakinicchāsahāya, the elision should be done, and the prescription of ākinic is for the purpose of excluding the elision.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: ayasmaya ādi pāṭhāt bhasajñāḥ manyate maitreyaḥ
translated: Maitreya considers it to be a bhāṣā word based on the reading of ayasmayā and so on.

analyzed: nanu ceda na chandaḥ
translated: But if it is not a Vedic text,

analyzed: ucyate
translated: it is said:

analyzed: tatra pāṭha balāt bhāṣāyām api bhasajñā bhaviṣyati
translated: By the power of the reading there, even in the bhāṣā, it will be a bhāṣā word.

original: ata eva ṭāṅasiṅasāminātsyā ityatra nādeśe karttavye inādeśavidhānamatijarasineti siddhyartha nyāse vyākhyātam /
analyzed: atas eva iti atra na ādeśe karttavye ina ādeśa vidhānam ati ja ra si nā iti siddhi artha nyāse vyākhyātam

original: nanu tathāpīyādeśo na syāditi katha yāvatā pratyayopadeśakāla ekyodeśena bhavitavyam /

analyzed: nanu yadīya ādeśena na bhavitavyam

analyzed: kṛte īya ādeśena bhavitavyam

analyzed: ucyate

analyzed: anubandha uccāraṇa sāmarthya labdhaḥ ayam arthaḥ iti

original: so'nubandho yasya tasya grahaṇe sa yatra nāsti tasya grahaṇa na bhavatītyaparo'syārtha ityāhuḥ /🔽tathā ca svādiṣvasarvanāmasthāne ityatrānayā prathamaikavacanagrahanamukta bhavati rakṣitena // //
analyzed: saḥ anubandhaḥ yasya tasya grahaṇe sa yatra na asti tasya grahaṇa na bhavati iti aparaḥ sya arthaḥ iti āhuḥ  tathā ca su ādiṣu a sarvanāmasthāne iti atra anayā bhavati rakṣitena  /
translated: They say that another meaning of this is: When that which has that anubandha is taken, that which does not exist there is not taken.🔽And thus, in svādiṣv asarvanāmasthāne, the taking of this first singular is said to be protected by Rakṣita.

analyzed: iti sīradeva kṛtāyā paribhāṣā vṛttau raktapādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Paribhāṣāvṛtti composed by Sīradeva, with Raktapāda.

analyzed: svara vidhau vyañjanam a vidyamāna vat  udātta ādi svara vidhau vyañjanam a vidyamāna vat syāt

analyzed: tena tavya pratyaya ādeḥ takārasya a vidyamana tvāt pratyaya ādeḥ akārasya udātta tva bhavati
translated: Therefore, because the ta of the suffix tavy is non-existent, the a of the suffix has udātta accent.

analyzed: karttavyam iti

original: udaśvitvānityatra hrasvanuḍbhyā matup ityanena takāreṇa vyavadhānāddhrasvātparo matub na bhavatīti tasyodāttatva na bhavati /

translated: In udāśvitvā, because of the ta of the suffix matup by the rule short and nasal, the matup does not come after the short vowel, so it does not have udātta accent.

analyzed: anayā tu paribhāṣayā prāpnoti

analyzed: tatra asyāḥ lakṣya sthiti anāśrayaṇena vṛtti kṛtā samāhitam

analyzed: samāsasya iti atra tu bhāṣye api etad doṣa parihāra artha ha l svara prāptau iti uktam
translated: But in the commentary on of a compound, this fault is avoided by saying in the attainment of the vowel of a consonant.

analyzed: atra ucyate

analyzed: a caḥ svara vidhānāt ha l svara prāptiḥ eva na asti
translated: Because of the rule of accentuation of a vowel, there is no attainment of the vowel of a consonant at all.

analyzed: tat kim ucyate ha l svara prāptau iti

analyzed: tatra uktam

analyzed: codyat ca yat atra āpadyate tat tatra eva parihṛtam iti
translated: And the objection that arises here is refuted right there.

original: jñāpaka cātrānudāttādeḥ ityasyāño bādhanārtha bilvādibhyo'ṇ iti vacana yadi vyañjana vidyamāna syāttadā bilvādayo'nudāttādayo na bhaveyuḥ
analyzed: jñāpaka ca atra anudātta ādeḥ iti asya añaḥ bādhana artha bilva ādibhyaḥ oṇ iti vacana yadi vyañjana vidyamāna syāt tadā bilva ādayaḥ anudātta ādayaḥ na bhaveyuḥ
translated: And the indication here is for the purpose of overriding the rule anu-datta-deḥ. The statement bilva-ādi-bhyaḥ aṇ is for the purpose of overriding the rule aṇ. If there were a consonant present, then bilva and others would not be anu-datta and so on.

original: anudāttasyājdharmatvāditi prāptireva nāsti /🔽mayaṭo bādhanārtha tu na vācyam /

analyzed: ma yaṭ bādhana arthe hi asmin bilva ādibhyaḥ oṇ iti aṇ grahaṇam anarthaka syāt
translated: For if the purpose of the statement bilva-ādi-bhyaḥ aṇ were to override the rule mayaṭ, then the use of aṇ would be meaningless.

analyzed: tasya hi idam prayojanam

analyzed: pāṭaliputra śabdaḥ utra paṭhyate

analyzed: tasmāt aṇ yathā syāt

analyzed: yathāprāpta abhyanujñāna inudātta ādeḥ ca ityam mā abhūt iti

analyzed: a ñaḥ ca ha l ādi tvāt aprāptiḥ iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that aṇ does not apply because it begins with ha.

analyzed: ima nija ādīnām ca cit kara namasyāḥ liṅgam upapadyate
translated: And the indication of the affix cit is appropriate for the words ima, nija, and so on.

analyzed: anyathā ima nicaḥ ha l anta tvāt etad antasya svara aprāpteḥ cit tvam anarthaka syāt
translated: Otherwise, in ima and so on, because it ends with ha, the property of being cit would be meaningless due to the non-obtainment of svar of that which ends with it.

original: udāharaṇāntara cāsyāḥ paurvārddhika dākṣiṇārddhikamityatra ṭhañi ñnityādinniratyam ityanena /
analyzed: udāharaṇa antara ca asyāḥ iti anena
translated: And another example of this is 'pauvārddhika' and 'dākṣiṇārddhika' here, where 'ṭhañ' is formed from 'diś' by 'ṇit' etc. and 'ṇyat' etc.

analyzed: asya arthaḥ

analyzed: yadi eva pūrva pada grahanam iha na kriyatā

analyzed: diśaḥ ṭhañ iti eva vaktavyam

analyzed: ca arthaḥ

analyzed: diśaḥ uttarasmāt arddha śabdāt ṭham bhavati iti na
translated: 'ṭhañ' is formed from 'ardha' after 'diś' and 'uttar'. Not so.

original: diśaṣṭhañityucyamāne diśaḥ svarūpagrahaṇa syāt pūrvapadagrahaṇe tu kṛte digityarthagrahaṇam /
analyzed: diśaḥ ṭhañ iti ucyamāne diśaḥ sva rūpa grahaṇa syāt pūrva pada grahaṇe tu kṛte diś iti artha grahaṇam

analyzed: tarhi pūrva grahanam eva kriyatām
translated: Then let the taking of the preceding word be done.

analyzed: atas eva artha grahaṇa bhaviṣyati
translated: Then the taking of the meaning will be done.

original: yathā parāvarādhamottamapūrvācca ityatra parāvarādhamottamebhya iti karttavye pūrvagrahaṇa parārddhyamityatra ṭhaño bhādhanārthamiti vṛttāvuktam
analyzed: yathā parāvara adhama uttama pūrvāt ca iti atra parāvara adhama uttamebhyaḥ iti karttavye pūrva grahaṇa parārddhyam iti atra ṭhañaḥ bhādhana artham iti vṛttau uktam
translated: Just as in 'parāvarādhamauttamapūrva' etc., where 'parāvarādhamauttamabhyaḥ' should be done, the taking of the preceding word is done in 'parārdhya' etc. for the purpose of prohibiting 'ṭhañ', as stated in the commentary.

analyzed: na etat

original: padagrahaṇe sati pūrvagrahaṇādarthagrahaṇe vyavasthāpite bahupūrvārddhyamiti bahupūrvādarddhaśabdādapi ṭhañ syāt /

analyzed: atra api diś pūrvasya arddha śabdasya vidyamana tvāt

analyzed: bahu c pūrvāt arddha śabdāt tu na bhavati

analyzed: tasya a pūrva pada tvāt

translated: Therefore, both the word 'pūrva' (preceding) and the word 'pada' (word) should be used.🔽And when this is so, what Maitreya said here in 'ṭhañ from the word 'pūrva' (preceding) in the direction' -

analyzed: yathā pūrva sūtre pūrva grahaṇasya vyākhyātam

analyzed: tathā atra asati api pada grahaṇe pūrva grahaṇāt eva sva rūpa grahaṇat nirastam iti tat na śobhanam  /

analyzed: yuṣmaṭpādaḥ samāptaḥ

analyzed: kriyā viśeṣaṇānām karma tva napusaka liṅga tā ca

analyzed: tat yathā  mṛdu paṭhati

analyzed: śobhana pacati

translated: But in the subsequent injunction, in the village, it is always you cook the clay and so on. If the words like clay etc. were in the nominative case, then even in the subsequent injunction, there would be an option by the rule The first case ending may be optionally used with the word 'atha' (then) and 'atha' (now) etc.🔽As in Then in the village, your blanket is yours.

analyzed: atha u grāme kambalaḥ tava svam iti

analyzed: tasmāt karma tva napusaka tva ca ubhaya karttavyam
translated: Therefore, both the accusative case and the neuter gender should be used.

analyzed: ca arthaḥ nyāsiddhaḥ iti āhuḥ
translated: And this meaning is not established by mere logic, they say.

translated: For example, in he cooks the clay, the action of cooking is the object because it is pervaded by actions like desire, determination, etc.

translated: For example,

analyzed: kaścid phalam īpsuḥ phala paśyati etasyāḥ etat phalam iti dṛṣṭvā prārthayate tatas tā karttum adhyavasyati
translated: someone desiring a result sees that this is the result of that. Having seen this, he desires it. Then he resolves to do it.

analyzed: atas tad viśeṣana karma eva

analyzed: tarhi tat pratyanupūrva mīpa loma kūlam iti jñāpayati

analyzed: iti paribhāṣā vṛttau ṭhak pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the affix 'ṭhak' in the Paribhāṣā-vṛtti.

analyzed: grahaṇavatī uccāravatā prātipadikena tad anta vidhiḥ pratiṣiddhyate
translated: The substitution of the ending by one that has it, by a nominal stem that is uttered, is prohibited.

translated: Nāḍāyana.

analyzed: na tad antāt

analyzed: sautranāḍiḥ iti
translated: Sautrānāḍi.

analyzed: vyapadeśi vat bhāvaḥ ca prātipadikena na bhavati
translated: And the state of being like a nominal stem does not occur with a nominal stem.

analyzed: kratu uktha ādi sūtra antāt ṭhak iti iha eva bhavati sagraha sūtram adhīte sāgrahasūtrikaḥ
translated: The suffix ṭhakk occurs here in the sutra ending with kratu, uktha, etc. One who studies the sutra along with the commentary is sagrahasūtrika.

analyzed: vyapadeśivat bhāvena kevalāt na bhavati
translated: It does not occur only by the state of being like a nominal stem.

analyzed: sūtram adhīte sautraḥ iti
translated: One who studies the sutra is sautrika.

original: jñāpite ete paribhāṣe yenavidhiḥ iti sūtre bhāṣyakṛtā /
analyzed: jñāpite ete paribhāṣe yenavidhiḥ iti sūtre bhāṣyakṛtā

analyzed: pūrvāt iniḥ iti asya anantara sa pūrvāt ca iti anena

analyzed: tat uktam

analyzed: kimartha sa pūrva ādiniḥ vidhīyate
translated: For what purpose is sa pūrva di niḥ prescribed?

original: pūrvaśabdena prātipadike viśeṣite tadantavidhinā sapūrvādapi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: pūrva śabdena prātipadike viśeṣite tad anta vidhinā sa pūrvāt api bhaviṣyati
translated: When the nominal stem is specified by the word pūrva, it will occur even from sa pūrva by the rule ending with that.

original: kevalācca vyapadeśivadbhāveneti nārtho'nena tat kṛta jñāpanārtham /🔽etacca jñāpayati ete paribhāṣe grahaṇavatetyādike sta iti /
analyzed: kevalāt ca vyapadeśi vat bhāvena iti tat jñāpana artham  etat ca jñāpayati ete paribhāṣe grahaṇavatā ityādike staḥ iti

original: ata eva pratyayavidhau jñāpitatvādgrahanavatetyādiparibhāṣādvaya pratyayavidhiviṣayamākhyāya gostriyorupasarjanasya ityatra tadantavidhinā
analyzed: atas eva pratyaya vidhau jñāpita tvāt graha navatā ityādi paribhāṣā dvaya pratyaya vidhi viṣayam ākhyāya go striyoḥ upasarjanasya iti atra tad anta vidhinā
translated: For this very reason, because it has been indicated in the rule of affixation, the two rules beginning with grahaṇavata are stated in the topic of the rule of affixation, and then by the rule ending with that in gostrīyoḥ upasarpjanasya,

analyzed: go śabda anta grahaṇa vyacakṣate

original: anye ca sāmānyena pratyayavidhau cāpratyayavidhau ca paribhāṣāmāhuḥ /
analyzed: anye ca sāmānyena pratyaya vidhau ca apratyaya vidhau ca paribhāṣām āhuḥ
translated: And others state a general rule for both the injunction of a suffix and the non-injunction of a suffix.

original: tathā ca śeṣo ghyasakhi iti pratiṣedhaḥ kevala eva na tadante atisakherāgacchatīti /
analyzed: tathā ca śeṣaḥ iti pratiṣedhaḥ kevalaḥ eva na tad ante atisakheḥ āgacchati iti
translated: And thus the prohibition śeṣo ghyasakhi is only a simple one, not atyanasakhi at the end of that.

analyzed: punar ca etayoḥ bhāṣye pratyākhyānam uktam
translated: And again, the rejection of these two has been stated in the Bhāṣya.

analyzed: tat uktam
translated: That has been said.

original: ādyāyāstāvatsiddha viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāva prati yatheṣṭatvādviśeṣaṇena hi tadantavidhirbhavati na viśeṣyeṇa /
analyzed: ādyāyāḥ tāvat siddha viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāva prati yathā iṣṭa tvāt viśeṣaṇena hi tad anta vidhiḥ bhavati na viśeṣyeṇa
translated: First of all, the relation of qualifier and qualified is established as desired, because the injunction at the end is with the qualifier, not with the qualified.

original: tatra samāsavidhau dvitīyāśrita ityādau yatsupsupeti prakṛta na tacchritādibhirviśeṣyate /
analyzed: tatra samāsa vidhau dvitīya āśritaḥ ityādau yat sup supā iti na tat śrita ādibhiḥ viśeṣyate
translated: There, in the injunction of compound, in dvitīyāśrita etc., the yatsupsup that is stated is not qualified by the śrita etc.

original: api tu tenaiva śritādayo viśeṣyante śritādibhiḥ subantairiti /
analyzed: api tu tena eva śrita ādayaḥ viśeṣyante śrita ādibhiḥ sup antaiḥ iti
translated: But rather, the śrita etc. are qualified by that itself, by the sup-ending words with śrita etc.

original: tena tadantavidhyabhāvānna bhavati kaṣṭa paramaśrita ityatra samāsaḥ /
analyzed: tena tad anta vidhi abhāvāt na bhavati kaṣṭa parama śritaḥ iti atra samāsaḥ
translated: Therefore, because there is no injunction at the end, the compound does not occur in paramaśrita due to the absence of difficulty.

original: pratyayavidhau naḍādibhyaḥ phak ityatra yatprātipadikāditi prakṛta tenaiva naḍāḍhyo viśeṣyante naḍādibhyaḥ prātipadikebhya iti teneha na bhavati
analyzed: pratyaya vidhau naḍa ādibhyaḥ phak iti atra yat prātipadikāt iti tena eva naḍa āḍhyaḥ viśeṣyante naḍa ādibhyaḥ prātipadikebhyaḥ iti tena iha na bhavati
translated: In the rule for affixes, phk from nada and others, by the previously stated from the nominal stem, only those ending with nada are specified, not from nominal stems beginning with nada.

analyzed: sūtranaḍasya apatya sautranāḍiḥ iti
translated: Sautranadi is the son of Sutra Nada.

original: yatra tu gṛhyamāṇena prakṛta viśeṣyate tatra bhavatyeva tadantavidhiḥ /
analyzed: yatra tu gṛhyamāṇena prakṛta viśeṣyate tatra bhavati eva tad anta vidhiḥ
translated: But where it is specified by what is being taken, the rule ending with that certainly applies.

analyzed: yathā upapada prakṛta bhaya grahaṇena āḍhya ādibhiḥ ca viśeṣyate
translated: As in upad it is specified by bhaya and adhya etc. which are in the present.

analyzed: atas tad anta vidhinā abhaya karaḥ na āḍhya bhaviṣṇuḥ iti
translated: Therefore, by the rule ending with that, abhayakara and anadhya will be.

original: svagrahaṇānuvṛttyā vyapadeśivadbhāvācca kevale'pi bhavati bhayaṅkara ityāḍhyaṅkaraṇa iti ca /
analyzed: sva grahaṇa anuvṛttyā vyapadeśi vat bhāvāt ca kevala ipi bhavati bhayaṅkaraḥ iti āḍhyaṅkaraṇaḥ iti ca
translated: By the continuation of the word sva and by the nature of being like a nominal affix, it also occurs with only bhayankara and adhyaṅkaraṇa.

original: kratṛvasthādisattrāntāṭṭhak ityatra tadantavidhinaiva tadantatve labdhe'ntagrahaṇa kevalānmābhūdityevamartham /
analyzed: iti atra tad anta vidhinā eva tad anta tve labdha inta grahaṇa kevalāt mā bhūt iti evam artham
translated: In the rule ṭhak from kratu, vṛddhi, etc. up to satra, by the rule ending with that itself, when ending with that is obtained, the word anta is for the purpose of not occurring with only.

analyzed: anyathā svam iti asya anuvṛtyā kevalāt api syāt
translated: Otherwise, by the continuation of sva, it would also be from only.

analyzed: atas eva vyapadeśi vat bhāvaḥ na pravarttate
translated: For this very reason, the nature of being like a nominal affix does not operate.

original: ki tveva gokulamityatra svagrahaṇānuvṛttyā vyapadeśivadbhāvāccopasarjanahrasvatva prāpnoti tatra tadantagrahaṇasāmarthyādvyapadeśivadbhāvo
analyzed: ki tu eva gokulam iti atra sva grahaṇa anuvṛttyā vyapadeśi vat bhāvāt ca upasarjana hrasva tva prāpnoti tatra tad anta grahaṇa sāmarthyāt vyapadeśi vat bhāvaḥ
translated: But here, in the word gokula, due to the continuation of the word sva and the nature of being like a designation, the shortening of the secondary element would be obtained. There, due to the power of the word tadanta, the nature of being like a designation

original: na bhavatīti bhāgavṛttikṛtā gostriyorupasarjanasya ityatra samāhitam /
analyzed: na bhavati iti bhāga vṛtti kṛtā go striyoḥ upasarjanasya iti atra samāhitam
translated: does not occur. This has been summarized by the author of the Bhägavata commentary in the word gostrīyorupasargasyêti.

analyzed: sva grahaṇa anuvṛttiḥ ca na sarveṣā matā
translated: And the continuation of the word sva is not accepted by all.

analyzed: samāsa pratyaya vidhau tad anta vidhi niṣedhe u k it varṇa grahaṇa varjam
translated: In the rule of compounding and affix formation, the rule and prohibition regarding the end of that, excluding the vowel u and the consonant i,

original: tena śritādīnā subantaviśeṣaṇatve'pi tadantavidherabhāvākaṣṭa paramaśrita ityatra samāso na bhavati /
analyzed: tena śrita ādīnām sup anta viśeṣaṇa tve pi tad anta vidheḥ abhāvāt parama śritaḥ iti atra samāsaḥ na bhavati
translated: Therefore, even though śrita etc. are qualifiers of the ending of a noun, due to the absence of the rule regarding the end of that, the compound does not occur in the word paramaśrita.

analyzed: tathā pratyaya vidhau bhavati
translated: Similarly, in the rule of affix formation, the affix ag is not added in the word naḍīra of the sutra,

analyzed: u k it varṇa grahaṇa varjam iti vacanāt tad ha nta vidhinā atibhavati iti dākṣiḥ iti bhavati
translated: because of the statement excluding the vowel u and the consonant i, the affix ta is added by the rule regarding the end of that, thus it becomes dākṣira.

analyzed: anyathā viṣṇu vācinoḥ śabdāt syāt
translated: Otherwise, it would be from the word viṣṇu.

analyzed: yena vidhi sūtre paribhāṣā rūpeṇa kaiścid padyate
translated: By which this vārtika is composed in the sutra of vidhi in the form of a rule by some.

analyzed: tu viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvayoḥ yathā iṣṭa tvāt
translated: But in the case of the established, the relation of qualifier and qualified is as desired.

analyzed: iti paribhāṣā vṛttau dhānya pādaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Dhannya Pada in the Paribhasa Vritti.

analyzed: svārthikāḥ prakṛtitaḥ liṅga vacanāni ativarttante api
translated: Even though the words ending in suffixes denoting relationship, class, and action override the gender and number of the base,

analyzed: tena kuṭire iti atra liṅga atikramaḥ
translated: hence in 'kuṭīra' there is an override of gender.

analyzed: ap kalpam iti atra ca liṅga vacanayoḥ ubhayoḥ api
translated: And in 'apkalpa' there is an override of both gender and number.

analyzed: pacatorūpa pacantirūpam iti atra vacana atikramaḥ
translated: In 'pacatorūpa pacantīrūpa' there is an override of number.

analyzed: apiśabdāt na api ativarttante
translated: The word 'api' (also) indicates that they do not override.

analyzed: kutsita uśva uśvakaḥ iti
translated: A despised horse is 'aśvaka'.

original: jñāpaka cātra ṇacaḥ striyāmañ ityatra striyāmiti vacanam /
analyzed: ca atra ṇacaḥ striyām iti atra striyām iti vacanam
translated: And the suffix 'ñac' in 'strī' is indicated by the word 'strī' in 'ñacḥ strī'.

analyzed: liṅga anatikrame hi striyam iti na karttavyam
translated: For if there were no override of gender, 'strī' should not be used.

original: karmavyatihāre ṇac striyām iti ṇacaḥ striyāmeva vidhānāt striyāmañapi siddha iti /
analyzed: karma vyatihāre ṇac striyām iti ṇacaḥ striyām eva vidhānāt striyām añ api siddhaḥ iti
translated: Because 'ñacḥ strī' is enjoined only for feminine nouns in the case of conflict with the object, 'strī' is also established by 'ñacḥ strī'.

analyzed: etasyāḥ udāharaṇa antaram
translated: This is another example of that.

analyzed: dvipadikā dviśatikā iti pustva napusaka tvayoḥ atikramaḥ
translated: 'Dvipadikā' and 'dvishatikā' are overrides of the neuter and non-neuter genders.

original: atra hi dvaudvau pādau dadāti dvedve śate dadātīti pādaśatasya sakhyādervīpsāyā vun lopaśca iti vunpratyayo'ntyākāralopaśca /
analyzed: atra hi dvau dvau pādau dadāti dve dve śate dadāti iti pāda śatasya sakhi ādeḥ vīpsāyāḥ vun lopaḥ ca iti
translated: For here, he gives two feet, he gives two hundred, so there is the affix vṛddhi for the foot and hundred, and the elision of the final letter, and the affix vṛddhi, and the elision of the final letter.

analyzed: atra codayanti
translated: And here they raise an objection.

analyzed: nanu kimartham anena vun vidhīyate kan eva vidhīyatām
translated: But why is this vṛddhi enjoined? Let the affix kṛt be enjoined itself.

analyzed: tena api hi dviśatikā iti siddhi ati
translated: For by that also, dvā-śatikam is accomplished.

original: eva ca sthūlādibhyaḥ prakāre kan iti kangrahaṇa karttavya na bhavati /
analyzed: eva ca sthūla ādibhyaḥ prakāre kan iti kangrahaṇa karttavya na bhavati
translated: And in this way, the affix kṛt should not be taken as in sthūla-ādi-bhyaḥ prakāre kṛt, because it would be repeated.

analyzed: etat eva hi anuvarttiṣyate
translated: And this is what will be repeated.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said.

original: yadi kan vidhīyetāntyalope kṛte dviśatiketi na syāt /
analyzed: yadi kan vidhīyeta antya lope kṛte dviśatikā iti na syāt
translated: If the affix kṛt were enjoined, after the elision of the final letter, dvā-śatikam would not be possible.

original: tathā kani bhasajñābhāvāddvipadiketi bhasajñānibandhanaḥ pādaḥ pat iti padbhāvo na syāt /
analyzed: tathā kani bhasajñā abhāvāt dvipadikā iti bhasajñā nibandhanaḥ pādaḥ iti pad bhāvaḥ na syāt
translated: Similarly, because of the absence of the bhāsa-jñā, the foot based on the knowledge of bhāsa in dvī-padīkam would not be possible, as the affix pad is based on the knowledge of bhāsa.

analyzed: atha astu pad bhāvaḥ tathā api dvipadikā iti na syāt
translated: Even if the affix pad is accepted, still dvī-padīkam would not be possible.

analyzed: pad bhāvasya ha l anta tvāt dvipatkā iti syāt
translated: Because the affix pad ends in a vowel, it would be dvī-padam.

analyzed: eva ca yat tatra rakṣitena uktam
translated: And in this way, what was said by Rakṣita there:

translated: Even if the affix kṛt is enjoined, dvā-śatikam is accomplished. The affix kṛt should not be taken as in sthūla-ādi-bhyaḥ prakāre kṛt, as one.

original: dvipadiketi tu bhasajñānimittapadādeśābhāvād rūpa ca na siddhyatīti tadayuktam /
analyzed: dvipadikā iti tu ca na tat ayuktam
translated: But it is not correct to say that the form is not established because there is no substitution of a word caused by bhāṣajña.

analyzed: ca kṛte dviśatikā iti etat api na siddhi ati
translated: And when the final vowel is elided and the k-affix is added, even this [form] dviśatika is not established.

analyzed: tat katham ucyate siddhi ati dviśatikā iti
translated: So how can it be said that even when the k-affix is added, dviśatika is established?

original: atha lopagrahaṇamapi na karttavya tarhi bhasajñānimittapadādeśābhāvād rūpa ca na siddhyatīti yadukta tadasaṅgata syāt /
analyzed: atha lopa grahaṇam api na karttavya tarhi bhasajñā nimitta pada ādeśa abhāvāt rūpa ca na siddhyati iti yat ukta syāt
translated: If the word 'elided' is also not to be used, then what was said - that the form is not established because there is no substitution of a word caused by bhāṣajña - would be irrelevant.

original: tathāhi yathā bhasajñā nāsti tathā dakārāntaḥ pācchabdo'pi nāsti katha vā tadrūpañca na siddhyatītyucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi yathā na asti tathā dakāra antaḥ na asti vā tad rūpam ca na
translated: For just as there is no bhāṣajña, so also there is no word ending in daka, so how can it be said that its form is not established?

original: yāvatā'ntyalope kṛte padādeśe cābhyupagate satyantyo yo'kārastasyettve sati dvipadiketi siddhyatyeva /
analyzed: yāvatā antya lope kṛte pada ādeśe ca abhyupagate sati antyaḥ yaḥ okāraḥ tasya ittve sati dvipadikā iti siddhi ati eva
translated: For when the final vowel is elided and the substitution of a word is accepted, then when the final vowel a has the i-augment, dvipadi becomes established.

analyzed: ca uttara phakkikāyāḥ lopa grahaṇa pratyākhyātavyam eva
translated: And moreover, the word 'elided' in the subsequent sutra should be rejected.

analyzed: adhunā tad pratyākhyānam ayuktam
translated: Now the rejection of that is not appropriate.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: rūpa ca na siddhyatīti yadukta tadubhayatra veditavyam /
analyzed: rūpa ca na siddhyati iti yat ukta tat ubhayatra veditavyam
translated: What was said - that the form is not established - should be understood in both cases.

analyzed: tatas iyam arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: dviśatiketi na siddhyati dvipadiketi ca na siddhyati /
analyzed: dviśatikā iti na siddhi ati dvipadikā iti ca na siddhi ati
translated: The word dvisatikā is not established, nor is the word dvipadī established.

analyzed: anye tu āhuḥ iha duravagamau maitreya abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Others say that the intention of Maitreya is difficult to understand here.

analyzed: na kevalam iha eva api tu anyatra api
translated: Not only here, but also elsewhere.

original: tathāhi vibhaktipāde adhunā ityatra sūtre rakṣitenoktam /

translated: Thus, in the Vibhaktipāda, in the sutra adhunā, it is said by Rākṣita:

translated: If this were the suffix adhunā, then it would be added in the previous sutra itself.

analyzed: vaktavyam
translated: This should not be stated for the purpose of the elision of the nasal and the affix.

original: idama iś itīśādeśe kṛte yasyeti lope satyadhunetyasya siddhatvāt /
analyzed: idamaḥ iti īśa ādeśe kṛte yasya iti lope sati adhunā ityasya siddha tvāt
translated: When the substitution of i for i is done, and the elision of yasya is done, then adhunā is already established.

analyzed: tasmāt asau anipātana artha yat pṛthak yoga karoti tatas anumīyate na ayam adhunā apratyayaḥ
translated: Therefore, since he makes a separate application for the purpose of the elision, it is inferred that this is not the suffix adhunā.

analyzed: tarhi dhuna eva

analyzed: sve ca viśeṣaḥ vṛtti kṛtaḥ abhipretaḥ

original: bhāṣye punaradhunāpratyaya evāya yasmādādisūtre kathitaḥ strī adhuneti pratyudāharaṇena /

translated: But in the Bhāṣya, this is indeed the suffix adhunā, because it is mentioned in the first sutra as strī adhunā by way of an example.

original: tathā tu yogavibhāgo'narthakaḥ asminkāle vastunīti vivakṣāyāmikoci iti nummābhūditi // //🔽śatapādaḥ samāptaḥ // //
analyzed: tathā tu yogavibhāgaḥ ūnarthakaḥ asmin kāle vastuni iti vivakṣāyām ikoci iti num mā abhūt iti 🔽śata pādaḥ samāptaḥ

analyzed: iti pañcamaḥ adhyāyaḥ  /

translated: The operation of a word with samprasarana is stronger than that without samprasarana.

original: tena juhāvayiṣatītyatra hvaḥ saprasāranam iti śācchāsāhvāvyā iti yuka badhitvā saprasāranam /🔽juhūṣatītyatrābhyastasya iti dvirvacanātprāk saprasāraṇam /
